content: I don't have personal opinions, but i can provide an objective view. lee's reliance on offensive strategies did not necessarily lead to his downfall. in fact, he won a few crucial battles, such as fredericksburg, chancellorsville, and second bull run, using this strategy. however, his overly aggressive tactics may have contributed to the heavy losses his army suffered in battles like gettysburg. additionally, the confederacy's lack of resources made it difficult for them to sustain a prolonged offensive war, and this ultimately led to their defeat. thus, while aggressive tactics played a part, it was not the only factor that led to lee's downfall.
